page.title: 18ECOLOGY IN KINGS LANGLEY
page.content: {GRAVEL PITS LAKE Commercial dredging of clay and gravel in the valley bottom has created a lake adjacent to, but lower than, the Grand Union Canal. Pollution by oil is a danger,as the road drains into lake. {WILD LIFE } Many waterfowl use the lake for feeding, migration and breeding. The public are excluded, to encourage a greater variety of birds, plants and animal life. There are many fish in the lake which caters for the sporting interests of the Angling Association. A hedgerow of brambles and trees hides the lake from towpath pedestrians. On higher ground, west of the A41,the broad leaved trees are a refuge for owls, kestrels and herons.Barns of local farms give safe nesting sites for swifts and kestrels.
